intro: Braya pycnophylloides, commonly known as the dense-leaved braya, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant is characterized by its dense, tightly packed leaves that help reduce water loss in dry environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, often in clusters. Braya pycnophylloides is adapted to rocky or sandy soils and is often found in desert scrub habitats.
